Replies.Reply: March 29, 1990      "But how will you die when your time comes, Narcissus, since you have no mother?  Without a mother, one cannot love.  Without a mother, one cannot die."
A pinpoint of light appears.
The embers glow.  Flame.
Heated by the furnace to over 1,300 degrees fahrenheit. White Hot.
Flickering flame casts dancing shadows on wooden walls. Coarsely grained wood.  Moisture blasted out by years of intense heat.  Timbers split.  Patched with new wood, it too now old and dry.
Billows up the walls.
On a narrow LEDGE, twenty feet about the Glassworks' floor. His clothing is Medieval.  A rough textured cassock. He is a MONK.

All dead.

I do what I have to do to keep the Brotherhood together.  We all gave up believing in Earth a long time ago.  How do you think they would feel if told their exiled was in vain?  That the holocaust they were trying to avoid never occured?  Those men up there have grown to live with it.

Pulls a blowing iron from the rack.  Feels its weight and balance.  A reasonable weapon.  She crosses to John.
You had to.  You're supposed to end suffering.
Let's get the hell out of here.
He's made a mess.
I'm glad.  Really.  But we've probably only got a few minutes before this entire place goes up in flames.  Just grab whatever books you want and --
Is there another way out?
You wanna give it a bandage?  Look --
Here's the plan --
Forget the books!
Shit.
Don't --!
Tries to pull herself up to the floor above --
Aargh.  I'm fine.  Let's get the fuck out of --
Don't worry.  Ship.  Just --
Don't be stupid --
They're lost.  You did your best.  If you get out, it wasn't in vain.
I told you -- the Earth is still there --
Not working.
It means I don't know how long I was in hyper sleep.
It means my clock isn't working.  We have to get out of here.  Even if he was right this ship's onboard computer is filled with man's knowledge.
Then man starts over.  He's done it before.
Okay.  The seals weren't broken so we're probably clear.  But those dead monks out there are going to start hatching soon.  Let's get ready to take off.
Here, I need a compressor tank from in that compartment.
I know.  I locked you in.
I'm not going with you.  I've got one inside me.
I figured it out.  That's why it didn't kill me.  He must have impregnated me when I was in the stasis tube.
It hasn't come out yet because I haven't eaten, It's still dormant.  So either I eat and it kills me or I don't eat and I starve to death.  Either way I die.
What, an exorcism?  No good.

I've set a time lock.  When the pod escapes the Colony's gravitational pull this compartment will open.  Then all you have to do is get into the Stasis tube with Mattias and press the blue button.  With any luck a freighter or something will pick you up.  Good luck.
It always wins.  We killed it, but it's still inside me -- You're my last chance.
What is this stuff?
I don't --
Why?
But you --
You'll die --
No - wait!  John!
Big, black shiny-smooth head moves into the taper light.
Rises out of the grass in front of the Holy Man.
Adapted itself to look like WOOD.
Steps towards Anthony --
Tail wraps around John's waist --
Yards away -- Limping.  Hissing.
Standing in the open doorway.
Limps into the room dragging one foot.
With crude brushes at the end of poles -- PAINT the sky blue.
The Sulaco Escape ship APPEARS in front of her.
John has his head buried in his hands.  His back rises and falls with the rhythmic breathing of sleep.
Brother John!  You're here!  The Abbot said you'd -- I need -- you're the medic --
My Sandy -- she's ill --
Sandy.  My ewe.
Father Anselm was the vet.
I just gave her dinner and she keeled over.
Been using the wood from the walls for the fire in my cabin.
What is it?
What?!  WHAT?!
BURSTS out of the jerking and twitching carcass.
A large circular room with wooden walls stretching thirty feet high.  Light creeps in through stained glass windows.
You have no voice in this tribunal.
Evil.
No.  Who knows what new evils she'll release if allowed back into that infernal machine.
Only finding the wood for the ship.  But Anderson's hut was about that big, and he's dead three months now.
I don't -- AAH --
Destruction!
No!  Don't let her!!
This woman is a danger.  She denies The New Dark Age.  She denies reality.
A Medieval elevator shaft.  The "elevator" is a wooden cage lowered on thick, rough hewn ropes.
Empty now except for the Abbot and the Tribunal Members.
The wood isn't going to last forever.
Drab, torn gray clothing.

Characters.Character: ON THE ROOF OF THE ABBEY

Replies.Reply: A dozen Monks frantically hammer planks up around the Sulacco escape ship - A frame of wood --
Planks are rising around the ship.
The two ANCIENT WORKERS continue their carpentry.
John and Mattias sit before an open book.
Here you go, woman.  Something from your ship.  Something to keep you company --
Different representations of Evil through the ages --
Yes, Father.
Extending down through huge open areas beneath the upper level.
few empty stalls and several grimacing faces, the second to last being The Abbot --
Gets colder every night.
Right up your bloody backside.  Nights like this make me miss plumbing -- Ack --!
In their stalls as the toilets reject a torrent of gore! Blood and viscera spraying the walls -- converting the Abbey into an abattoir.
Angle on the Orbitor Arceon:  An orb of wood hands peacefully against a tapestry of celestial seas.
Take it.
You waiting for meat?  They don't bring me meat because they know I'm an android.
Mmmm.  Just a little crunchy.
You don't eat, you'll starve to death, girl.
Because I'm a synthetic person you don't think I can care?
You told me you had a bad experience and a good one with androids --
You've still gotta eat.  You gotta fight the bastards --
He?  You make it sound like this Alien has a personal score to settle with you.
Medieval Monks.
And they've only chose to live the life style, they don't believe they're --
What's that?
Hey -- you knocking -- cut it out --
Brother John?
Made too good for that.  What're you doing?
What?  You look like you've seen the devil.
You mean he --
It must be able to take on some of the characteristics of the animal it grows in.
It's a biped.  In a sheep or cow, a quadroped.
Not for years.
Satellite.
The Company planted me here.
They built this prison.
Prison.  They are all political heretics.  Ripley looks at John.
A computer virus.  A bad program.  By this time the Corporate structure was transglobal, all the world's data storage systems were linked.  It spread through two countries before it was stopped.
This was a threat --
I was placed among them as a sensor.
I told them.  After the supply ship's stopped coming I saw no point in keeping up the charade.  Since I was a sort of walking reminder of technology, they cast me down.
In Heaven.
This orbiter was patterned after a medieval concept of the universe --
They call the top half "Heaven - "
The bottom half is "Hell."  Where we are.
Really.
We don't have weapons here.
There is technology.
A room.  A Technology room.  Fresh air and water come out.
The heart and lungs of Arceon.
One level beneath the underground sea.
On the other side of the orbiter.
Balanced precariously on the top of the ladder in the real world as he fights against the demons in his android mind --
SEES a horrible BIRD-DEMON grasping his hand in its beak --
No - please.  Just let me sit.
Damn it.
The reason I'm down here.
Dreams.
That's probably what they thought when they built me.  But my brain is cyber-

Right.  Maybe they've fixed this on later models, but I don't.  Do you know what happens to the human brain when it is deprived of sleep?  It starts to run off the dreams while you're awake, as hallucinations.  Same thing with me.
What I always see.  Images of Monsters.
Just images I've absorbed from those old books and have no way to get rid of.
My head is full of them.  I try to get them out any way I can.
I know that.  I'll settle for rest.
You should've eaten the bread.
Enough rest.  There's beasties afoot.
We're getting close to the center of the arc -- near the sea.
She's helping us --
The Organism.
Bringing up the rear, puts his walking stick down --
Man trap.
In case anyone tried to get in and tamper with the technology.
No I won't.  He's a terrible liar.
It's ironic.  I guess my visions were prescience after all.  How will I ever resolve that with my artifical con-
More than that.  There are pumps beneath the floor - I can feel their vibration.
The Greenhouse Effect.  It's how the Earth almost destroyed itself in the late 20th century.
This planet is the supreme triumph of planned obsolesence.  A certain amount of primitive materials with an atmosphere processing system as fragile as a real environment but not replenishable.
I didn't have to see that to know what that means.
I'm confused.  Before you said it came out of the torso, not the head --
There are several inconsistancies between this and the other Aliens you described.
I think this is important.  This may help us fight it.  The creature that I fought in the hall - when I first saw it, it had camoflaged itself to look like wood.
I don't think it was.  I think that this creature, if it is the efficient predator that you say it is, has the ability to adapt to its environment.
Or this may be an as yet unseen stage of development -- you saw a queen -- This could be like a King ant -- more highly advanced than the drone, bred for survival -?
Don't have second thoughts.  Blind and crippled I would only slow you down.
Ripley, I know.  Good luck.
Now the seer can only see what God wants him to.  Forty years on a planet of Monks and I've finally found religion.
John?  Ripley?
Well come then.  I haven't got forever.

Just beneath the Monastery level of the satellite: an Underground Wheatfield.  Tall golden grass stretches out for miles, swaying gently around huge wooden columns that support the Abbey fifty feet above --
A lattice-work of suspended troughs and wooden pipes --

Descend the ladders single file.  Fear is in all of their faces though most have only heard the stories.  They move cautiously into the wheat.  Spread out through the field in the jaggedly drawn skirmish line.
THRASH and POKE their way forward leaving trails through the high grass.  Their attempt at an orderly progression quickly falls apart as they get strung out all over the field.
John is just climbing off, Anthony right behind him. Anthony is winded.  He reaches up for a helping hand.
Rest!
Climb through a hole where a trap door has been torn off it's hinges.  They look at the grim tableau:  Monks impaled on their own pikes.
Back against the book stacks.
RUN at the Alien.
Ceiling so low their torches must be held out in front of them.
Liquid drips through the ceiling planks over head.

Characters.Character: THE DOOR TO THE TECHNOLOGY ROOM

Replies.Reply: A huge wooden door with no knob or handle.  Looks like it could almost be part of the wall.  John and Ripley are the first to it.  They put down their planks and begin to feel around the edges of the door for some purchase.
Anthony lags behind.  He senses a presence in the hallway.
Ripley, John and The Abbot knock on the door, walls.
Ripley is trying to work.  She punches numbers into the keyboard.
Ripley is getting no response from the keyboard.
A primitive KEYBOARD.  Circa late twentieth century.
Hears the sound again.  Turns.
SNAP!!

Characters.Character: FACE TO FACE WITH THE ALIEN

Replies.Reply: Anthony drops his staff and grabs each of the alien's arms with his own android arms.  His extra-human strength keeps them from squeezing him any tighter, but he cannot avert his gaze from the smooth, eyeless face.
Lights:  CODE ACCEPTED Ripley's head whips towards the corridor --
Acceptance tone "bings."
Real Man of LaMancha wood and cloth windmills.  Two story high arms slowly rotating.  Moving enormous volumes of air through the wind tunnel-like room.  As far as the eye can see.
Is all that sits atop the blood spurting neck of the Abbot.

The ladder shaft opens onto a barnacled pier.  Ripley and John climb out onto the wooden structure.  Before them:  AN UNDERGROUND SEA stretches the width of the entire planet, over five miles across.  The floor of the lowest level of the top half of the orbiter makes a ceiling that looms a hundred feet overhead.
Lit from within by daylight beaming down from above -- pours into the sea a short distance from them.
Passes underneath the boat.  A swimming CREATURE.  The Alien.
A hundred foot climb.  The wood is twisted.
Heaven has become HELL.
Flickering fires lit the first few floor windows.
Snaps and barks at the Alien --
The Alien, John and Ripley PLUMMET down -!
The Alien FALLS into the molten glass vat --
THE ALIEN'S head breaks the surface of the molten glass.

Characters.Character: THE HUGE DUMP TANK OF WATER

Replies.Reply: DUMPS.  Empties a thousand gallons --
A MEDIEVAL ETCHING.
Ripley's back arches --
SLITHERS out of Ripley's mouth --
